text:
In one of my old branch, I bumped into a bug that was actually fixed in master [here](https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/commit/3781b2beea3b031aa5fd16704c20de49887483cc).

On my way of fixing it again, I added a test to `check_niimg` and tweaked an error message. I thought I would do a pull request to justify wasting my time.
title: Add test for check_niimg with ensure_3d=True and a non 3d image as argument
Add test for check_niimg with ensure_3d=True and a non 3d image as argument

title: Pull request merge from lesteve/nilearn:add-test-for-check-niimg-with-non-3d-image to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: Just wondering whether this test was supposed to use `data_img` rather than `data` and be pretty much identical to the test I just added. Here `data` is a numpy array, and you get an error like "a 3D image is expected but an iterable was given", which is good enough to make the test pass.
title: (11, '', u'nilearn/tests/test_niimg_conversions.py')
